intro: Critoniopsis ayabacensis, commonly known as the Ayabacé mountain orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found in the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structures. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and colorful, displaying a range of hues that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Critoniopsis ayabacensis is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
